description: From poly- +‎ pharmacy, after Ancient Greek πολυφάρμακος (poluphármakos).

entries.meaning: (medicine) The use of multiple drugs to treat multiple concurrent disorders in the same (now especially elderly) patient, chiefly with connotations of indiscriminate or excessive prescription. [from 18th c.]
examples: Critics denounced physicians as meddlesome, capriciously practising an often dangerous polypharmacy – a blunderbuss approach.
